abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the Economic Management
            and Growth Credit Project (EMGC) were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was modest, the Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and the borrower performance
            was satisfactory. The lesson learned included: (a)
            operations with deep institutional reform require longer
            time horizon than a one year quick disbursing loan.
            Institutional reforms are inherently difficult and time
            consuming to implement as changes will normally happen at
            slow speed and over a number of years; (b) uncertainty on
            the timing of policy implementation increases by requiring
            amendments to the constitution, which are beyond control of
            the Government; (c) continuity of policy dialogue on broad
            based operations calls for experienced staff with good
            knowledge of the country; (d) operations involving
            comprehensive reforms require quality supervision; and (e)
            expectations should be realistic in the case of one-year
            adjustment operations.
